key_points: H-E-B is temporarily closing some Texas stores and reducing operating hours due to Winter Storm Uri.
Affected areas include greater Houston, North East region, Gulf Coast, Austin, Central Texas, and San Antonio.
Most stores are opening at 9 or 10 a.m. and closing around 5 to 7 p.m.; pharmacy hours align with store hours.
Stores have closed in Austin, Central Texas, and San Antonio due to extreme weather conditions.
Millions of Texans are experiencing power outages and water shortages following record cold temperatures.
H-E-B has prioritized conserving energy to help preserve the Texas energy grid.
Store hours and operations are subject to change based on local conditions.
Supply chain disruptions have led to limited product assortments and purchase limits at some locations.
H-E-B describes Winter Storm Uri as an unprecedented event causing severe disruptions to the food supply chain.
Online grocery services, including curbside and home delivery, have been suspended.
